result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeffrey D. Gatlin Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-THC (<=200 grams) [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Full time work/school or combination or complete 9 hours community service each week not so engaged.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

DNA sample.

Assessment/treatment/counseling as recommended.

Case called: 3:40 PM 
Clerk: Brenda
State appears by ADA Kyle Mayo:
Defendant appears by Paul Zilles;
Includes 15CF786, 16CF147, 16CF395 and 16CF642;
VRCW - No restitution requested;
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed. 

State moves: 16CF147 Ct 1 (BJ-Felony-Repeater) - D&RI; Ct 2 (DC-Domestic-Repeater) - D&RI; 16CF395 Ct 3 (BJ-Felony) - D&RI; Ct 4 (Possess Drug Parapher) - D&RI; 16CF642 Cts 1-3 (BJ-Felony) - D&RI -- COURT GRANTS ALL .  
Deft admits previous conviction - properly charged as subsequent offense.

PLEA: 15CF786 Ct 1 (Possess w/intent THC-Second and subsequent offense) - Guilty; 16CF395 Ct 1 (Possess THC-2nd+) - Guilty; Ct 2 (BJ-Felony) - Guilty.  

Crt advises def of rights & penalties & ques def to understanding.  Crt finds plea & waiver freely & vol made, a factual basis & def guilty.  
Deft makes statement.

COURT ORDERS: SWH - 3 Years probation on each count concurrent to each other. Conditions: Assessment/treatment/counseling as recommended, full time work/school or combination or complete 9 hrs community service each week not so engaged, maintain absolute sobriety, pay cc, provide DNA Sample + surcharge.  Parties may agree by written stipulation as to jail credit.

Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief filed.

Cases 15CF786, 16CF147, 16CF395, 16CF642 called: 8:43am
State appears by ADA C.Minder. Deft appears in person with Atty Lou Ann Bohn (counsel on 15CF786, 16CF395 and 16CF642); Atty Abernethy-Mays (counsel on 16CF147) does not appear.

COURT questions defendant re: missed appearance - Defendant was approx 20 minutes late, and stayed to quash warrant at IAs the same day.
State makes argument - admonishment of defendant is requested, and then would withdraw request for BF.
Defendant states he was pulled over for traffic violation and that was the reason for being late.

COURT does forfeit bond at this time

COURT notes to defendant he does not have unlimited chances for requests for counsel, as he has already had 2 attorneys, and Atty Abernethy-Mays is on 147 case.
Clerk requests defendant's updated address - defendant gives in court.

DAY REPORTING TO BE TRANSFERRED TO MERCY HEALTH.   No controlled substances without valid prescription and only in the amount prescribed.  Absolute sobriety from illegal drugs.  No contact with victim(s):  J.M. Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.
